visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing the comparison of Recommended Dietary Allowances (RDAs) for 10 B vitamins between men and women using synthetic data with gender-based statistical distributions

title.text: RDA of B Vitamins for Men and Women

subtitle.text: Source: Synthetic data based on typical nutritional guidelines

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two quantitative series (Men/Women RDAs) across 10 categorical vitamin groups. Synthetic values were generated with Men μ=1.5mg (σ=0.3) and Women μ=1.3mg (σ=0.2), maintaining realistic nutritional ranges while introducing natural variation through normal distribution sampling. The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by removing gridlines while preserving clear value comparisons through direct labeling. Gender differentiation employs Cairo's preattentive processing principles using high-contrast hue variations (#058DC7 vs #c7058d). Statistical anchors in tooltips and formatted labels (+0.2mg avg gender difference) support precise interpretation. Temporal patterns are intentionally excluded as irrelevant to this cross-sectional nutrient comparison.
